title: Pacific Northwest Farmers, Retailers Hurt By Labor Dispute At West Coast Ports
teaser: Work has resumed at West Coast ports after nearly nine months of slow downs and work stoppages. Despite last week's tentative labor agreement, it could take months to get things back to normal. There's a huge backlog of goods — some perishable — that need that need to be offloaded from vessels.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
